result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian J Hoffman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:58 AM Defendant Brian J Hoffman in court, in custody, with attorney Abigail J. Broze.   Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called for plea and sentencing.
State places offer on the record.
Court conducts plea colloquy.

Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.
State and Defense make sentencing recommendations.
Defendant makes statement to the court.

The Defendant was sentenced to the following:
JAIL: 30 Days in the Waukesha County Jail ( w/Huber and all standard release conditions if the Defendant has a verified job),  otherwise Straight-time. Consecutive to any sentence currently being served. 
0  Days Credit.

Costs:  $243
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid in 120 days, or be converted to a civil judgment for non payment of fee.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
